item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Jepsen: Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL 17.4 (185 points | 53 comments)
2. Chain of Recursive Thoughts: Make AI think harder by making it argue with itself (307 points | 150 comments)
3. Bamba: An open-source LLM that crosses a transformer with an SSM (114 points | 35 comments)

7. Waymo partners with Toyota to bring autonomous driving to personal vehicles (5 points | discuss)
8. It's School time: Adventures in hacking an old Kindle (55 points | 7 comments)
9. Show HN: Beatsync – perfect audio sync across multiple devices (158 points | 46 comments)
10. Modern Realty (YC S24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
11. Performance optimization is hard because it's fundamentally a brute-force task (196 points | 92 comments)
12. ArkFlow: High-performance Rust stream processing engine (125 points | 27 comments)

14. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (159 points | 126 comments)

16. Firefox tab groups are here (452 points | 284 comments)

21. Indian court orders blocking of Proton Mail (256 points | 109 comments)
22. The missteps that led to a fatal plane crash at Reagan National Airport (50 points | 38 comments)
23. Show HN: AgenticSeek – Self-hosted alternative to cloud-based AI tools (54 points | 10 comments)
24. We need more optimistic science fiction (61 points | 67 comments)
25. Show HN: Flowcode – Turing-complete visual programming platform (153 points | 67 comments)
26. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (662 points | 304 comments)
27. A single line of code cost $8000 (274 points | 350 comments)
28. AirBorne: Wormable zero-click remote code execution (RCE) in AirPlay protocol (45 points | 6 comments)
29. Try Switching to Kagi (562 points | 388 comments)
30. Gaussian Splatting Meets ROS2 (50 points | 12 comments)
